title: The Biden Blowout
body:
On Friday morning investors gave a less-than-mixed reaction to the gargantuan spending plans President-elect Joe Biden unveiled in a Thursday night speech. For Mr. Biden perhaps it can serve as a little reminder not to mistake Americans’ revulsion at the Capitol mob for an endorsement of his agenda. Elected by unenthusiastic voters exhausted by the Trump era, Mr. Biden will find that even Americans eager for Mr. Trump to leave office don’t necessarily want the end of Trump economic gains.
On Thursday this column noted a new measurement of the staggering cost of the Biden tax proposals for U.S. businesses and the people who work for them. Some investors are starting to pay attention.
The Journal’s Paul Vigna and Caitlin Ostroff report:
It’s true that recent shopping data, constrained by renewed state lockdown policies, have been lousy. Harriet Torry and Sarah Nassauer report:
On the other hand, there’s encouraging news on manufacturing. Sarah Chaney Cambon reports:
